sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些连词均含有"因为"之意。
means: as ：从属连词，语意较because, since弱，着重在主句，所表示的原因或理由是"附带的"。
because ：从属连词，语意强，着重直接的原因或理由，所引出的从句是全句的重心，用以回答why提出的问题。
for ：并列连词，语气较弱，所引出的句子一般放在后面，表示附带说明的理由或推断理由。
since ：语意比because弱，但比as强，一般用于表示"由于大家已知的事实"。

sentence.Network_en: She feels devalued because she knows her husband has had affairs.
sentence.Network_cn: 她觉得自己掉价了，因为她知道丈夫有了外遇。

sentence.Network_en: I denied my father because I wanted to become someone else.
sentence.Network_cn: 我和父亲断绝了关系，因为我想成为一个不一样的自己。

sentence.Network_en: I get very nervous because I'm using a lot of expensive equipment.
sentence.Network_cn: 因为正在使用很多昂贵的设备，所以我非常紧张。

your father disowned you because you have sinned., 你的父亲否认你因为你的罪.

jx.jx_en_mean: on account of; by reason of

lj.lj_ly: they moved here because of the baby.
lj.lj_ls: 他们为了孩子而搬家到这里。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English : from the phrase by cause, influenced by Old French par cause de 'by reason of'

entry.def: You  use because when stating the reason for something.

example.ex: He is called Mitch, because his name is Mitchell...
example.tran: 人们叫他米奇，因为他大名叫米切尔。

example.ex: Because it is an area of outstanding natural beauty, you can't  build on it...
example.tran: 考虑到这一带自然风光旖旎，你不能建在这里。

entry.def: You use because when stating the explanation for a statement you have just made.

example.ex: Maybe they just didn't want to ask too many questions, because they rented us a room without even asking to see our papers...
example.tran: 也许他们只是懒得问太多的问题，因为他们都没要求看我们的证件就把一个房间租给我们了。

example.ex: The President has played a shrewd diplomatic game because from the outset he called for direct talks with the United States...
example.tran: 总统玩了一场高明的外交游戏，因为从一开始他就要求和美国直接对话。

entry.def: If an event or situation occurs because of something, that thing is the reason or cause.

example.ex: Many families break up because of a lack of money...
example.tran: 许多家庭由于缺钱而破裂。

example.ex: Because of the law in Ireland, we had to work out a way of getting her over to Britain.
example.tran: 由于爱尔兰的法律所限，我们不得不想办法把她弄到英国去。

entry.def: You use just because when you want to say that a particular situation should not necessarily make you come to a particular conclusion.

example.ex: Just because it has a good tune does not mean it is great music...
example.tran: 仅凭旋律优美并不见得就是一首杰出的音乐作品。

example.ex: Just because something has always been done a certain way does not make it right.
example.tran: 仅仅因为老是以某种方式做事并不意味着这么做就是对的。

stems_affixes.word_buile: be构成一些介词+cause原因→conj.&adv.因为

stems_affixes.value_cn: 原因,导致某事发生的人或事,动机,目标,事业
stems_affixes.word_buile: caus理由,原因+e→n.原因,导致某事发生的人或事,动机,目标,事业 v.引起,惹起,使[发生],促成

stems_affixes.value_cn: 饶恕,致歉,理由,口实,借口
控告, 谴责, 非难
stems_affixes.word_buile: ac=ad+cuse=cause理由→v.控告, 谴责, 非难
caus理由,原因+e→n.原因,导致某事发生的人或事,动机,目标,事业 v.引起,惹起,使[发生],促成

sentences.en: I study because I want to learn.
sentences.cn: 我学习是因为我想学到知识。

means.word_mean: [用于引导一个名词从句，相当于 that 或 the fact that]…这一事实，…这一点原因，原因是

sentences.en: The reason I am here is because I want to ask for your help.
sentences.cn: 我之所以到这儿来是想寻求你的帮助。

means.word_mean: [用于省略句，表示暂不便说明详细理由]不解释

sentences.en: I think it would make her feel better because.
sentences.cn: 我想它会使她觉得好受些。原因嘛，现在不说。

means.word_mean: [口语][用于叙述原因或说明提出问题]

sentences.en: You must not think ill of her because she did not love you.
sentences.cn: 你不该因为她不爱你就认为她这个人不好。

means.word_mean: [口语][用于省略句,相当于 on account of being]是…的缘故

sentences.en: The bed was uncomfortable because too dirty.
sentences.cn: 因为太脏，这张床睡得不舒服。

jushi.english: I study because I want to learn.
jushi.chinese: 我学习是因为我想学到知识。

jushi.english: Just because they make more money than I do, they think they are so superior.
jushi.chinese: 只因为他们挣钱比我多,他们就认为自己高人一等。

jushi.english: Because the husband is vile—should the wife be vile too?
jushi.chinese: 做丈夫的不正派,是不是做妻子的也应不正派呢?
